Why your features should be informative. Mathematical justification.

title: About
text:
My name is Konstantin Selivanov. I am a machine learning engineer and researcher.
My focus is representation learning and sequence modeling using deep learning methods. I am good at implementing papers and optimizing the ml algorithms. All the startups where I worked as first ml engineer were profitably sold. Some were backed by Google Ventures and Sequoia by more than $100 millions. I lead ml teams. Sometimes I do consulting. Feel free to reach out to me.
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/selivanov/
Github: https://github.com/c0stya

title: About
text:
Interests

representation learning, embeddings, contrastive learning and information retrieval
natural language processing, large language models (aka LLMs)
generative models: autoencoders, flows and diffusion models
sequential models: RNNs, transformers, mamba, rwkv

Other topics in machine learning and computer science:

reinforcement learning and game theory
formal languages and compilers, automata theory
logic and formal proofs, Coq, Metamath
low-level C/CUDA programming

I like minimalism and efficiency. Can do low level code optimization. Linux user for 20 years. I love math and philosophy.
